Mr Gbagbo, who the international community says lost November's presidential election, has refused to give up power. His opponent, Alassane Ouattara , was certified the election winner by the United Nations, but remains to a luxury hotel by security forces loyal to Mr Gbagbo. In a statement released today, the Central Bank of West African States( BCEAO) protested at Mr Gbagbo's decision to take over its operations in Ivory Coast, calling the move`` a flagrant violation of international agreements . The bank ordered all its offices in the country to be closed until further notice. Soldiers and military police surrounded the bank's headquarters in the capital, Abidjan, yesterday.
